column1: On August 11, 2008, the Federal Reserve conducted an auction of $25 billion in 84-day credit through its Term Auction Facility. Following are the results of the auction:
column2: Stop-out rate:2.754 percent  Total propositions submitted:$54.800 billionTotal propositions accepted:$25.000 billionBid/cover ratio:2.19  Number of bidders:64
column3: Bids at the stop-out rate were prorated at 80.00% and resulting awards were rounded to the nearest $10,000 (except that all awards below $10,000 are rounded up to $10,000).
column4: The awarded loans will settle on August 14, 2008, and will mature on November 6, 2008. The stop-out rate shown above will apply to all awarded loans.
column5: Institutions that submitted winning bids will be contacted by their respective Reserve Banks by11:30 a.m.EDT on August 12, 2008. Participants have untilnoon EDT on August 12, 2008, to inform their local Reserve Bank of any error.
